items.title: Leveraging tax credits and incentives for sustainability projects

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Randa Barsoum, Tax Partner at PwC US, highlights that energy tax credits are only part of the picture and draws attention to less obvious incentivesâ€”such as state and local abatements, location-based incentives, and R&D tax credits tied to innovation like reimagining packaging or processes. The core message: viewing sustainability investments through a broader tax lens can unlock meaningful tax value.
bullets: Energy incentives are common but not the only tax opportunities for sustainability projects.
State and local abatements can support sustainability initiatives.
Location-based incentives may provide additional tax value tied to where projects are sited.
R&D tax credits can apply to innovation efforts, including reimagining packaging or processes.
A broader tax perspective can turn sustainability investments into meaningful tax value.
takeaways: Donâ€™t limit assessments to energy creditsâ€”also evaluate state and local abatements and location-based incentives when planning projects.
Include potential R&D tax credits in the financial case for innovation-driven sustainability initiatives.
Screen available incentives across jurisdictions to maximize tax value from sustainability investments.
Treat sustainability investments as potential sources of tax value, not only as costs.

items.title: Why data is critical to sustainable supply chains

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ David Linich, Sustainability Principal at PwC US, argues that reliable, high-quality data lets organizations scenario plan, protect margins, and deliver sustainable, high-quality products at the right place and time. With conditions changing week by week, data-driven decision-making is presented as essential for building resilient, modern supply chains.
bullets: Reliable, high-quality data is foundational for scenario planning.
Data helps protect margins amid shifting tariffs and margin pressure.
Enables delivery of sustainable, high-quality products to the right place and time.
Supply chain conditions can change week by week, raising the need for timely insights.
Data-driven decision-making is key to resilient, modern supply chains.
takeaways: Prioritize obtaining and maintaining high-quality supply-chain data to support scenario planning for equipment and parts procurement.
Use data-driven scenarios to anticipate disruptions and protect operating margins under changing tariff and cost conditions.
Incorporate sustainability metrics into supply-chain data to meet ESG goals while ensuring reliability and product quality.

items.title: Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Naseema McElroy, a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, California, brings in $251K a year by working three jobs and running a personal finance brand called Financially Intentional. She documented her finances after accumulating nearly $1 million in debt in 2015 and became debt-free by 2017.

takeaways: Employees may combine multiple jobs and side businesses to achieve high earningsâ€”consider scheduling and retention strategies that account for multiple income streams.
